Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, catalytic hydrogenation with Pt nanoparticles
Other Information.Additional Info: Terminal alkene selectively hydrogenated due to size and orientation constraints.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, catalytic hydrogenation with Pt nanoparticles
Other Information.Additional Info: Bulky internal double bond prevented from accessing active sites by small pore apertures.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Room temperature, catalytic hydrogenation with Pt nanoparticles
Other Information.Additional Info: Sterically demanding molecule excluded by molecular sieving effect of ZIF-8.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Exposure of CdSe/ZIF-8 composite to thiol molecules
Other Information.Additional Info: Bulky thiol unable to access encapsulated quantum dots due to small aperture size.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Exposure of CdSe/ZIF-8 composite to thiol molecules
Other Information.Additional Info: Smaller thiol capable of accessing encapsulated quantum dots, quenching luminescence.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with regioselective guest reactivity.

Experimental Validation.Method: Catalytic hydrogenation experiments, photoluminescence quenching studies
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Selective hydrogenation of n-hexene versus trans-2-hexene and cis-cyclooctene; selective quenching of CdSe quantum dot emission by 2-mercaptoethanol but not cyclohexanethiol.

Other Information.Additional Info: Encapsulation strategy allows control over spatial distribution of multiple nanoparticles within ZIF-8 matrix while preserving microporous properties for molecular sieving applications.
